author: Matthew P
title: DEED IT FORWARD
description: What is our **GREATEST** untapped resource? **++We are!++** Pay it forward is great concept, but how can we do **more** to actively help our fellow humans?

assessments.note: While a App like this could bring more people to cardano and help our mission it doesn't really have to. It's not a 100% clear how this app could benefit our community. It would be great if the proposal had a more in depth explanation how this app brings more progress to cardano except from being able to tipp someone.
The proposed concept is unique and has the potential for worldwide deployment with sufficient scaling. It can provide a boost to Cardano adoption.

There is no clarity in the problem described in the problem statement, I recommend making this definition clearer.

The concept described is within the scope of the challenge, but the absence of a detailed plan, metrics and goals makes it impossible to indicate impact on the challenge.

I recommend that the proposal be more detailed so that we can give appropriate feedback.

This proposal doesn't explain how it will use Cardano Community fund to create a Quality Dapps and integrations that will increase utility & adoption of Cardano. The project doesn't meet the Challenge of Fund 5 Dapps. Please think of how and why you would need to use Cardano blockchain to advance its adaption? What problem are your proposal  solving?
It's a good idea to leverage a trustless decentralized system such as cardano with a smart contract capability to connect ppl in need of a help with their community

The development of the app started 6 years ago and it couldn't find adoption so there is no guarantee this is going to change after funding the proposal. I think it would help as well if the team or the proposer would be introduced. Then apparently the app is already finished or almost finished. 200k is a huge budget. I think it would help if the proposer would add a more detailed budget to the proposal the next time.
Proposer already tried and failed to get this off the ground. Why is now different? No detailed plan provided.

The proposer has created the app and had launched it. He must be having the required technical capability. However, the proposal's scale and scope are huge and will require a strong multifaced team to handle the expansion. There is limited information and a plan for role out of the project.

There is no plan. There is no information about the team (nor links) that indicate the feasibility and aptitude of executing the proposal. There is no budget breakdown.

It looks like the project (app) has been in development since 2015, but there are no details.


This proposal is a draft and has the potential to be a dapp in line with the challenge, but it is important to provide a detailed plan, I recommend following the Catalyst documentation to elaborate the proposal.
This proposal doesn't include a team or a project plan. Therefore making it unfeasible. Please revisit your proposal by developing a step by step plan on how you plan to implement this proposal.

The proposer has started the application, so there's less unknown, however, with a request for 200K for a single developer team without clear defined project plan as well as milestones, it's going to be a challenge to achieve a favorable outcome

This proposal could provide a lot more of informations to help its assesment. There is no clear roadmap, no risk assesment (even though they are already 6 years in development). Then if you read the proposal and the comments it's not quite clear if the App is actually finished or still in progress.
proposer asking for 4/5 of the fund. They have already failed to get the idea off the ground once. Strong evidence should be provided as to why this time would be different.

There is a need for a plan and team composition. There time plan and roadmap for implementation also required to be deliberate. Being a high valued project, these details will add clarity and audibility.
There is no information that allows auditability. It would be important do include details about metrics, roadmap, KPIs, budget breakdown, following the Catalyst docs.
This proposal lacks a roadmap, KPI's, and milestone. Please review and include how progress will be tracked on this proposal.
There's not enough information to be able to gauge how one qualify as success criteria, ie. #users in community, partnership with local community, etc.

solution: DeeditForward is a tool that crowdsources the act of helping; connecting a person in need with those ++willing++ to help in their own community.
experience: This App startup began in 2015. COVID halted progress. Time to inject new life with much needed funds and a crypto integration?
